title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: the interview was smooth and easy. the interviewer was very professional. The process didn't take too long. Questions were easy and cleared. I recommended this place. Smile bring your papers, just focus on questions
Interview Questions: what was the last incident that you de-escalated and how was the result?

title: Patient Care Associate (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: The manager of the department was amazing to talk to! She was so kind and very supportive of my education and work life. The staff seems amazing already too and people only want the best for you.
Interview Questions: So tell me about yourself!

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick, simple, and very easy, especially for someone new to being interviewed. All instructions for before the interview and how to get to the location were very thorough.
Interview Questions: Q: What are you expecting from this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Very well, very informative. Asked questions such as strengths and weakness. Why you wanna work here etc. Asked about a situation involving a difficult patient and how you went about handling it
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview by 2 people, explained well about the job responsibilities, the pros and cons were also well explained. After the interview, they called for a medical fitness test and security clearance.
Interview Questions: how will I fit for this position

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: Very great, easy to work with HR to find out more information regarding the position. Able to make sure I was available during multiple times. Very accommodating to my schedule and ensured they had a time available for me to interview.
Interview Questions: Previous job history, questions regarding my resume, strengths and weaknesses, questions regarding the position

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about interest and why you are interested. Asked about what you are interested in doing in the future. On zoom because of pandemic making it more convenient and easy.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: Calming and rewarding experience. Interviewers were very nice and open and not harsh. They offered great detail of the program and asked fair questions. It was relaxed and offered comfort and no stress.
Interview Questions: How would your  professors describe you?

title: Volunteer/Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: The interviews are solely conducted through the volunteers office. Relatively easy, no difficult questions and doesn't require a lot of preparation. As long as they know you're there for the right reasons you are sure to get into the program.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to intern here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the next day I got a phone call from HR to set up an interview with the hiring manager. I set up a FaceTime interview with the manager the next day. Interview was about 30 minutes long. Very relaxed. Mostly went over my qualifications/experience. Got a call the next day with a job offer.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle difficult families. 
Went over a list of qualifications.

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Bayonne, NJ) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, asked about who you are as a person.  Mainly looking for customer service experience.  Great for entry level. You will be interviewed by all managers and executive director.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Describe yourself as an employee?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Englewood Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a very fast process. I had a call with human resources 1 week after i applied online, then met with the dept director, and accepted after 2 weeks.  I did have to follow up with human resources a few times before i officially accepted though
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Must apply through the Englewood Health Careers, website.  Resume must contain needed qualifications to be considered.  When criteria matched, applicant will get a initial interview via phone call.
Interview Questions: Why choose Englewood  Health?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Englewood Health in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on company website. Then I was invited to interview the next day. Interviewed at HR office w/ HR Representative, then w/ department manager. I got called with an offer later on that same day.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in food service. Have you worked in a medical care facility before? What skills will help you in this position?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and after a month I was called in for an interview,  HR asked me four questions and then proceeded to take me to the lab and I was shown around by the supervisor.
Interview Questions: How would my manager describe me

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Was called by HR for a phone screening a couple of weeks after applying. During this call they just confirmed general info and set up an in-person interview. Met with HR for about 30 minutes and was asked general behavioral questions and about my background. After that met with the department director for about 45 min where more technical questions about my background and previous experience related to the role came up. About a week later was offered the position and was asked to come in for drug test. Started 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions:
What would your references say about you? 
Salary requirements. 
What are your long-term goals?
Tell me about yourself...

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted my resume and applied directly through there career portal. I was called a week later to come in for an interview. I was interviewed by Jean in HR and then given a tour of the facilities, I then met with supervisors and General Managers of the OR suite, both RN's. Everyone was great and it seemed like a lovely place to work and grow with a team. Ultimately the OR manager didn't want to take on a new CST without inpatient experience since she just hired two techs right out of school, she didn't want me to leave without an offer so she forwarded my resume over to the nurse who took care of the hospital's outpatient facility and staff. I was offered a 
Per Diem position but unfortunately could not take.
Interview Questions:
Q:What particular surgical procedures are you familiar with?
Q:Do you have inpatient experience?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call from the member of the hiring team to ask questions and schedule an in person interview, what was set up in 2 weeks,followed by an in person interview with the hiring manager. They were late and made me wait almost 2 hours outside of their office.
Interview Questions: Do I have any experience in hospital

title: Human Resources TEMP POOL Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied, got called in for an interview the next day, then got hired on the spot. Overall it was a very easy process. My friend referred me which probably made the hiring process easier.
Interview Questions: What are your extracurricular activities?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Secaucus, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview learn few things about the job watch few videos about the job and how to talk to people and keep them calm in a violent act
Interview Questions: How I am working with people and taking care others

title: Medical Records Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Harvey, IL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Reume was send from career representative from the school I recently graduated from. I received a telephone interview; to give a brief account of my qualificatiions and skills. I was scheduled for an interview with the supervisor in the Medical Records department. I dressed accordingly; in a black pants suit and my porfolio. I was given a description of the office duties, introduced to the staff and asked if I had any questions. I asked several questions pertaining to the position.  My resume was reviewed and that was the end of the interview. I was told I would be contacted in two weeks. When I did not get a response in the two weeks, I called to inquire about my status. I was told I was overqualified and that they were looking for someone long term. I was puzzled, because I was never asked over the phone or in person interview about my long term goals. I stated I was just getting back into the work world because I had been unemployed for two years and I had just completed another course to upgrade my education. I stated I did not have a problem with starting off as entry level.  The office staff that I was introduced to seemed standoffish. (they were not comfortable with a newcomer). That made me feel a little uncomfortable but not unfocused on my purpose for being there.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in Medical Records?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Englewood Health (Englewood, NJ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: senior management and HR handled the interviews.  was given a tour off the departments that were involved and other areas of the facility.  an future appointment was made for the job offer and to meet with employee health and a drug screen.
Interview Questions: prior employment background
